12/1/23: CUAD divestment proposal for the ACSRI, annotated

CUAD uses the Columbia College referendum as a key indicator that a majority on campus support divestment.

On November 14, 2023, CUAD published a Spectator op-ed that proposed six key demands, including divestment from "Israeli apartheid" and reinstatement of Columbia’s chapters of Students for Justice in Palestine and Jewish Voice for Peace, which the University had suspended four days prior. A total of 94 student groups and organizations signed the op-ed.

The proposal attempts to overcome the consensus hurdle presented by the ACSRI by demonstrating that past successful divestment efforts used referenda and demonstrations as signifiers of campus consensus. The proposal also makes the point that historically, successful divestment proposals have not required any specific number of “yes” votes from the campus community to demonstrate consensus.

Source: Spectator reporting, ACSRI proposals

Graphics by Ava Fung
